name: GuWei Museum visit with afternoon tea set
location: GuWei Museum, 21 Wong Chuk Hang Road #33/F Wong Chuk Hang, HKI
about: In this special visit, we will explore the GuWei Museum with an expert guided tour lasting 1.5 hours. We will conclude with afternoon tea, enjoying stunning panoramic views of Aberdeen Lower Reservoir and Lamma Island at the Museum Coffee Shop. The GuWei Museum is committed to passing on both Chinese and foreign traditional cultures to the next generation by organizing exhibitions and cultural and educational activities. During this visit, you will have the opportunity to view the new exhibition, “The Wanli Shipwreck: Blue-and-White Porcelain in Global Trade.” Our guide will share insights about their collection and the stories behind it.Date and Time: July 19 (Sat) 2:30-4pm (Guided Tour), Afternoon tea after tourFee: $160/person. Fee includes guided 1.5-hour guided tour, along with an afternoon tea set that features coffee or tea and a cake.About Guwei Museum www.guweimuseum.comCo-founded by Mr. Franco Cutrupia, Chairman of the Sapientia Foundation, and his wife, Ms. Pauline Ngai Cutrupia, the GuWei Museum is the first private museum in the Southern District to blend exhibitions, cultural education, and leisure. Opened to the public on 24 September 2024, the museum features a diverse collection of 1,035 artefacts from various historical periods and regions worldwide. These include porcelainware, silverware, carpets, paintings, textiles, and jewellery, inviting visitors to explore the distinctive patterns, forms, and colours that represent both Eastern and Western cultures. In addition to its exhibitions, the museum offers a vibrant array of workshops and programmes for all ages, inspiring creativity and bringing fresh dynamism to Hong Kong's cultural landscape.

name: Hong Kong Monster Building Mini Tour 怪獸大廈微導賞
dateTime: Hong Thai Expo and Business Centre
location: Urban Room, Shop #20, G/F, Yick Cheong Building 1046 King's Road Quarry Bay, HKI
about: Welcome to our mini-guided tour and sharing, where we will explore the "Monster Building" located in Quarry Bay. While the name may sound a bit intimidating, this residential complex actually hides many beautiful aspects that are often overlooked.During this tour, we will delve into the history and unique design of the Monster Building, exploring its origins and the architectural elements that give it character. We will also briefly introduce the concept of "Urban Room" and discuss how such spaces can promote community interaction and sustainable development.The "Monster Building" consists of five residential towers, and the public cannot enter the private residential areas. Please be respectful while visiting the public spaces.Adverse Weather Arrangements:Typhoon Signal:If the observatory issues a Typhoon Signal No. 3 or above within 3 hours before the event starts, the event will be canceled.If all typhoon signals are removed or changed to Signal No. 1 within 3 hours before the event starts, the event will proceed as scheduled.Rainstorm Warning Signal:If the observatory issues a red or black rainstorm warning signal within 3 hours before the event starts, the event will be canceled.If all rainstorm warning signals are removed or changed to a yellow rainstorm warning signal within 3 hours before the event starts, the event will proceed as scheduled.The organizers will announce the latest arrangements for adverse weather through their social media accounts, so please stay tuned for updates.Each registration is limited to 2 slots, and each email can register only once.Participants must be 6 years old or above; those under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.Participants will need to navigate stairs and slopes.If a registered participant is absent from the event, the registration fee will not be refunded, and no shopping vouchers will be issued.Participants who are late by 10 minutes or more on the day of the event will be considered absent, and their slot will be allocated to on-site registrants. The registration fee will also not be refunded.DisclaimerThis activity is an individual walking free participation and is not an organized event. By participating in this tour, you agree to the following terms:Risk Acknowledgment: You understand and accept the risks associated with participating in this tour, including but not limited to accidents, injuries, or loss of property.Liability Waiver: The organizers are not liable for any direct or indirect loss, injury, or accident that may occur as a result of participating in this tour.Medical Disclaimer: If you have any health concerns, it is advisable to consult a medical professional before participating in the event.Consent to Participate: You confirm that you have read and understood this disclaimer and voluntarily choose to participate in the activity.

name: 保險員脫單船河
location: 西貢, Sai Kung Hong Kong, NT
about:
夏日炎炎，最好嘅活動當然就係出海！嚟緊7月20號，首個專為金融保險界單身貴族而設嘅船河，想大家一齊嚟chill！
📅 日期：2025 年 7 月 20 日 (日)
🕗 時間：09:30 - 17:00
📍 地點：西貢
你係咪成日覺得...
💭返工壓力大到爆，有苦自己知？客又煩，同事又難頂，老闆更加唔明你？
💭想搵人傾訴吓，但係又唔知同邊個講？
💭單身貴族都會悶喇，想搵個啱傾嘅人一齊享受生活？
💭參加其他單身派對，人哋一聽到你做保險就耍手擰頭？
*專為保險精英打造嘅理解同共鳴* ，嚟星際脫單船河，你就可以..
✔️同其他保險公司嘅同行交流吓，搵到真正明白你嘅人
✔️喺輕鬆愉快嘅環境下放鬆吓，享受吓難得嘅假期
✔️識多啲新朋友，擴闊吓圈子，話唔定仲搵到另一半添！
✔️玩盡豐富嘅海上活動，留低美好嘅回憶
✨ 水上活動包括：香蕉船，吹氣滑梯，海上泳池，Wakesurf (仲有教練指導!!🏄🏻‍♀️)，唱k，麻雀...應有盡有！
💌 名額：30位💰費用：HK$1580
希望今次船河係一個好機會俾大家逃離繁忙嘅生活，享受夏日美好時光，同埋識吓新朋友！期待你哋嘅參加，一齊出去玩啦！
💌 名額有限，立即行動！

name: Surf Camp (5-9yrs)
location: Pui O Beach, Pui O beach Lantau Island, NT
about: Surf Camp is an ideal day camp for beginner and younger surfers. Surf Camp includes 3 hours surfing and 1 hour land-based session of beach safety, ocean education and fun & games every day. Children return home every evening and all pick up and drop off are at the Central Ferry Pier No.7. Lunch and snacks are included. Surf Camp group photos of your little surfers will be uploaded onto our Facebook page each week! For individual orders please purchase our photography package.

name: Hong Kong Audio Tour: From Stars to Signal Hills
location: Avenue of Stars, Hong Kong, Avenue of Stars, Hong Kong Ave of Stars, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong KongAve of Stars
about:
Embark on the Kowloon Kaleidoscope Tour: From Stars to Signal Hills – Your Personal Adventure in Yau Tsim Mong!
				Step into the soul of Yau Tsim Mong, Hong Kong with our immersive self-guided audio tour. Wander through historic streets, uncover hidden gems, and let the city's rich tapestry of stories unfold at your own pace. Whether you're a history enthusiast, a curious traveler, or someone seeking a unique experience, this tour is your perfect companion.
				 
				🗺️ Tour Details

name: The area of the richest - The Peak
location: In front of World Wide House, Central MTR Exit A (環球大廈門口，中環站A出口), 19 德輔道中 Hong Kong, HKI
about: [ [The tour is by reservation only. The tour tips will be collected at the beginning of the tour. $300 per head. ]Why do Hong Kongers walk and drive fast? Why do HKers look impatient? Why are the HKers willing to line up for 1 hour+ to dine in a restaurant? Why is housing so expensive in HK?We will walk around the richest area of HK - The Peak and show you the hidden place of the Peak.Let's start a tour with a licensed tour guide. In the 3 hours tour, you will understand1. History of hong kong and the Peak2. The unique culture in HK3. The insider's place and architecture4. How to navigate in HK through public transport5. The must try or must do in Hong Kong.We will meet up at Central Exit J2 and take the Peak Tram to the Peak. We will dismiss at the Peak.

name: Traditional Chinese Walled Village + 300 years old Temple
location: 大圍站, Tai Wai MTR Station Hong Kong, NT
about: Most of the tourists visit Hong Kong Island and Kowloon but rarely visit New Territories. People asked me where are the buildings over 300 years old. The British colonial period started in 1841 (only 182 years ago). What did Hong Kong look like in the pre-colonial period?In this tour, I will take you to the ancestral hall of the traditional Chinese House. I will also show you the tradition of worshipping god in a temple.1. Traditional Walled Village - Tsang Tai UkOne of Hong Kong’s best-preserved walled villages. You can still see the original granite, bricks and timber used to build the village. Guard towers were built on each of the four corners to protect against pirates, who ran rampant in Hong Kong until the early 20th century. This is still a living village.2. Sha Tin Che Kung TempleThis is a temple of 300 years old. Was built before the colonial period. You will learn about the traditional culture3. The Old House at Wong Uk Village Wong Uk Village was founded during the reign of Qianlong (1736-1795) in the Qing dynasty by the Wong clan from Xingning county in Guangdong. In the 19th century, the village became a major trading station for travellers and traders plying the route between Guangdong and Kowloon and prospered until the late 19th century. I will show you how to appreciate the fine mural paintings and traditional decorations on the traditional house.4.High Rock CentreIt was old police barracks of Shatin and also the place for orphans. The main building was a large, two-storey brick and wood building.5 ,6,7..... and more places in the tours. By the end of the tour, you will have more understanding of the traditional side of Hong KongMeeting Point:We will meet at Tai Wai Station Exit B. In front of DHL express.Tai Wai Station is on East Rail Line of the MTR.The tips for the tour will be collected at the beginning of the tour, HK$300 per person. More than 3 people will be offered a discount.If you want to have a one-person tour, HK$500.I guarantee it is worth the cost.
